Name: Turkey. Locative
Content:
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1251\deff0\nouicompat\deflang1049{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Roboto Condensed;}{\f1\fnil\fcharset204 Roboto Condensed;}{\f2\fnil\fcharset162 Roboto Condensed;}{\f3\fnil\fcharset238 Roboto Condensed;}}

\pard\cf1\f0\fs24\lang1033 ### Turkey. \f1\lang1049 Locative\par
\par
{\cf0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xNb_Os--bUs&t=662s&ab_channel=Pratikturkce }}{\fldrslt{https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xNb_Os--bUs&t=662s&ab_channel=Pratikturkce\ul0\cf0}}}}\f1\fs24\par
\par
\f0\lang1033 #words:\f1\lang1049\par
\f2\lang1055 b\f0\lang1033 athroom - \f2\lang1055 banyo\par
hotel - otel\par
house - ev\par
post office - postane\par
\f0\lang1033 sea - \f2\lang1055 deniz\par
airport - havaliman\f3\u305?\f2\par
pool - havuz\f1\lang1049\par
\f0\lang1033 zoo - \f2\lang1055 hayvanat bah\f0\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055 esi\f1\lang1049\par
port\f2\lang1055  - liman\f1\lang1049\par
\f0\lang1033 museum - \f2\lang1055 m\f0\lang1033\'fc\f2\lang1055 ze\par
left - sol\par
right - sa\f3\u287?\f1\lang1049\par
\f0\lang1033 kitchen - \f2\lang1055 mutfak\par
\f0\lang1033 breakfast\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 - \f2\lang1055 kahvalt\f3\u305?\f1\lang1049\par
food\f2\lang1055  - yemek\par
castle - kale\par
\f0\lang1033 north - \f2\lang1055 kuzey \f1\lang1049 - \'f1\'e5\'e2\'e5\'f0\par
\f0\lang1033 west - \f2\lang1055 bat\f3\u305?\f1\lang1049  - \'e7\'e0\'ef\'e0\'e4\par
\f0\lang1033 there - \f2\lang1055 orada\f1\lang1049\par
Siberia\f2\lang1055  - Sibirya(turk).\f1\lang1049\par
merkez\f2\lang1055  - center\f1\lang1049\par
mountain\f2\lang1055  - da\f3\u287?\f1\lang1049\par
\par
\f0\lang1033 #expressions\par
\f1\lang1049\par
\par
\par
Ben kilisedeyim, sen neredesin?\par
Restoranda \f0\lang1033\'e7orba var.\f2\lang1055  There is soup at the restaurant.\par
Otelde ku\f3\'balar var.\f2  \f0\lang1033 There are birds at the hotel.\par
Ben okulday\f3\u305?m.\f0  I am at school.\par
Pasta pastanededir, postanede de\f3\u287?il.\f0  The cake is at the bakery, not at the post office.\par
Ben hastanedeyim, sen pastanedesin. I am at the hospital you are at the patisserie.\par
Fil postanede domates yer. The elephant eats a tomato at the post office.\par
Restoranda \'e7orba var. There is soup at the restaurant.\par
Banyo \'e7ok k\'fc\'e7\'fck.\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 The bathroom is very small.\par
Sen bakkaldas\f3\u305?n.\f0  You are at the grocery store.\par
Tuvalette \'f6r\'fcmcek var. There is a spider in the toilet.\par
Evin bir odas\f3\u305?\f0 . A room of the house. (\f1\lang1049\'e4\'ee\'ec\'e0 \'ee\'e4\'ed\'e0 \'ea\'ee\'ec\'ed\'e0\'f2\'e0\f0\lang1033 )\par
Affedersin, Sultan Ahmet camisi nerede? Excuse me, where is the Blue Mosque?\par
Havuzda \'e7ocuklar var.\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 There are children in the pool.\par
Denizde kaplumba\f3\u287?a yok.\f2\lang1055\par
Hayvanat bah\f0\lang1033\'e7esindeyiz.\f2\lang1055  We are at the zoo.\f0\lang1033\par
Kumsalda bira i\'e7!\f2\lang1055  Drink a beer on the beach!\f0\lang1033\par
\f1\lang1049 Kaptan limanda.\f2\lang1055  The captain is at the port.\par
\par
Ben havaliman\f3\u305?nda onlara kitap okurum.\f2  I read a book to them at the airport.\par
\par
\f3\u304?stanbul'da \f0\lang1033\'e7ok m\'fcze var.\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 There are many museums in Istambul.\par
Solda bir k\'f6pek var. There is a dog on the left.\par
Sa\f3\u287?\u305?mda bir ku\'ba var.\f0  There is a bird on my right.\par
Ayasofya'n\f3\u305?n b\f0\'fcy\'fck bir bah\'e7esi var. The Hagia Sophia has a big garden.\par
\f3\u304?stanbul T\f0\'fcrkiye'nin kuzey bat\f3\u305?s\u305?nda.\f0  Istanbul is in the northwest of Turkey.\par
\par
Ayasofya'n\f3\u305?n kuzeyinde \f0\'e7ok m\'fcze var. There are a lot of museums in the north of the Hagia Sophia.\par
AyasofyaNIN kuzeyI = possessive construct. North OF THE Hagia Sophia.\par
Also after posesive -i if you add a case suffix like -de then you need an "n" in between. -inde -\f3\u305?nda\f0\par
\par
\par
Kaplumba\f3\u287?alar onlarda.\f0  They have the turtles.\par
\par
\par
K\'fc\'e7\'fck kedi bizde. We have the little cat.\par
Eski \f3\'baarap sende.\f0  You have the old wine.\par
\f2\lang1055 Elmalar sende. \f0\lang1033 You have the apples.\par
Pasta onda. She has the cake.\par
Onlar benim patronlar\f3\u305?m.\f0  Those are my bosses.\par
\'d6rdek bende. I have the duck.\par
G\'fczel ku\f3\'balar onda.\f0  He has the beautiful birds.\par
Benim kedim orada.\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 My cat is there. \f2\lang1055 My cat is over there.\f0\lang1033\par
\'d6\f3\u287?renciler kalede.\f0  The students are in the castle.\par
Bah\'e7ede, kahvalt\f3\u305?day\u305?m.\f0  I am in the garden, at breakfast.\par
Ben mutfaktay\f3\u305?m.\f0  I am in the kitchen.\par
Buras\f3\u305? bir postane.\f0  Here is a post office.\par
Ankara'da \'e7ok kedi var. There are many cats in Ankara.\par
Mimar Ankara'da \'e7ay i\'e7er. The architect drinks tea in Ankara.\par
Eski postanede k\'f6pekler var. There are dogs at the old post office.\par
\f2\lang1055 Neden havuzda de\f3\u287?\f2 il. Why is she not in the pool?\par
\f0\lang1033\'d6\f2\lang1055 rdekler denizde. The ducks are in the sea.\par
Limanda de\f3\u287?\f2 ilim havaliman\f3\u305?\f2 nday\f3\u305?\f2 m. I am not at the port, I am at the airport.\par
Ben havaliman\f3\u305?nda onlara kitap okurum.\f2  \f3 I read a book to them at the airport.\f0\lang1033\par
gen\'e7 filler onda\f2\lang1055 . She has the young elephants.\par
Buras\f3\u305? bir postane.\f2  \f0\lang1033 Here is a post office.\par
Orada kim var? Who is there?\par
Kahvalt\f3\u305?da kimin \f0\'e7ocuklar\f3\u305? var?\f0  Whose children are at the breakfast?\par
Bizim evimiz orada. Our house is there.\par
Bu oda. This room.\par
\par
\par
I read a book to them at the airport. Ben havaliman\f3\u305?nda onlara kitap okurum.\f1\lang1049\par
i am not at the port i am at the airport\f0\lang1033 . \f1\lang1049\par
\par
kumsalda\f0\lang1033  \f1\lang1049 kaplumba\f3\u287?alar var.\f0\lang1033  There are turtles at the beach.\par
kapta limanda. The captain is at the port.\par
Hayvanat bah\'e7esi. zoo.\par
bah\'e7ede \'e7ocuklar var. There are children in the garden. \f2\lang1055 bah\f0\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055 e - garden\par
The ducks are in the sea. \f0\lang1033\'f6rdekler denizde\f2\lang1055 .\f0\lang1033\par
\par
neden havuzda de\f3\u287?il\f2\lang1055 . \f0\lang1033 whe she is not in the pool.\par
\par
\f2\lang1055 I read a book to them at the airport.\f0\lang1033  \f2\lang1055 Ben havaliman\f3\u305?\f2 nda onlara kitap okurum.\par
\par
Kita\f3\u287?\f2 lar sizde. You have the books.\par
\par
What is the difference between "Elmalar\f3\u305?n var" and "Elmalar sende"?\par
The first is "You have apples." (literally, apples belonging to you exist.) The second one is saying "You have THE apples. (literally, the apples that we are discussing are with you [as opposed to in my house or in Selcan's car])\par
Both can be translated as "have" in English but I think you can see there's a difference in meaning.\f2\par
\par
\f1\lang1049 o bizde yok\f2\lang1055 . We do not have it.\par
\par
He has the beautiful birds.\par
\par
Here is a post office. Buras\f3\u305?\f2  bir postane.\f1\lang1049\par
Orada\f2\lang1055  \f1\lang1049 kim\f2\lang1055  \f1\lang1049 var?\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 Who is there?\par
I am in the kitchen. \f2\lang1055 Ben mutfaktay\f3\u305?\f2 m.\f1\lang1049\par
\f2\lang1055 Mimar Ankara'da \f0\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055 ay i\f0\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055 er. \f1\lang1049\par
\f0\lang1033 The cats drink milk in the castle. \f2\lang1055 Kediler kalede s\f0\lang1033\'fc\f2\lang1055 t i\f0\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055 er.\f1\lang1049\par
\f0\lang1033 Whose children are at the breakfast? \f2\lang1055 Kahvalt\f3\u305?\f2 da kimin \f0\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055 ocuklar var?\par
Bizim evimiz orada.\par
Ankara'da g\f0\lang1033\'fc\f2\lang1055 zel bir kad\f3\u305?\f2 n.\par
(Ankara'da g\f0\lang1033\'fc\f2\lang1055 zel bir kad\f3\u305?\f2 n var.)\f1\lang1049\par
bah\f0\lang1033\'e7ede kahvalt\f3\u305?day\u305?m\f2\lang1055 . I am in the garden, at breakfast.\par
Ben hastanedeyim, sen pastanedesin.\par
The elephant eats a tomato at the post office. Fil postanede bir domates yer.\par
\par
Ya\f3\'bal\u305? adam restoranda tavuk yer.\f2\par
\f1\lang1049 Why can't I start the answer with restoranda?\par
If you begin the translation with Restoranda then Restaurant becomes the subject of the sentence rather than the old man and the emphasis changes to the location rather than who.\par
\par
Ben hastanedeyim, sen pastanedesin.\par
\f0\lang1033 Q: \f1\lang1049 I wrote the same except i omitted ben and sen. Why is it wrong as they still have the pronoun in the verb identifying the subject\f2\lang1055 .\par
\f0\lang1033 A: When you have a sentence that has more than one pronoun, you must put all the pronouns in the sentence. An example is this sentence. Hope this helps.\par
\par
The old man eats chicken at the restaurant. Ya\f3\'bal\u305? adam restoranda tavuk yer.\par
\par
evin bir odas\u305?\f0 . A room of the house.\par
\f2\lang1055 Affedersin, deniz nerede?\par
\f0\lang1033\par
\f3 The\f0  \f3 ducks\f0  \f3 are\f0  \f3 in\f0  \f3 the\f0  \f3 sea.\f0  \'d6rdekler denizde.\par
\f2\lang1055 Denizde \f0\lang1033\'f6\f2\lang1055 rdekler var\f0\lang1033 . There are ducks in the sea.\f3\par
\f2\lang1055\par
>>> 05-05-2021 22:58\par
neden havuzda de\f3\u287?\f2 il?\par
annem neden havuzda de\f3\u287?\f2 il?\f1\lang1049\par
\f2\lang1055 neden havuzda de\f3\u287?\f2 ilsin?\par
\par
kumsalda kaplumba\f3\u287?\f2 alar var\par
ben havaliman\f3\u305?\f2 nda onlara kitap okurum\par
\par
\par
The museum is on the right. m\f0\lang1033\'fcze sa\f3\u287?ada\f2\lang1055 .\par
\par
Ayasofya'n\f3\u305?n b\f0\lang1033\'fcy\'fck bir bah\'e7esi var.\par
\par
There\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 is\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 a\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 bird\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 on\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 my\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 right.\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 Sa\f3\u287?\u305?mda bir ku\'ba var.\f2\lang1055\par
\f1\lang1049 Those are the suffixes for verb to be. You need possessives:\par
Benim sa\f3\u287?\u305?mda, senin sa\u287?\u305?nda, onun sa\u287?\u305?nda, bizim sa\u287?\u305?m\u305?zda, sizin sa\u287?\u305?n\u305?zda, onlar\u305?n sa\u287?\u305?nda.\par
\par
\f0\lang1033\'e7\f2\lang1055 ok m\f0\lang1033\'fc\f2\lang1055 ze, iki m\f0\lang1033\'fc\f2\lang1055 ze, be\f3\'ba\f2  m\f0\lang1033\'fc\f2\lang1055 ze\par
\par
Ayasofya'n\f3\u305?n kuzeyinde \f0\lang1033\'e7ok m\'fcze var.\par
Sibirya'n\f3\u305?n merkezi\f2\lang1055 (n!)\f3\lang1033 da \f0\'e7ok da\f3\u287? \f0\'e7ok.\par
Sibirya'n\f3\u305?n merkezinde \f0\'e7ok say\f3\u305?da da\u287? var.\par
\u304?stanbul T\f0\'fcrkiye'nin kuzey bat\f3\u305?s\u305?nda.\par
solda bir k\f0\'f6pek var\f2\lang1055 . bir k\f0\lang1033\'f6\f2\lang1055 pek solda.\f3\lang1033\par
\f0\par
\f1\lang1049 They have the small crab.\f0\lang1033  K\'fc\'e7\'fck yenge\'e7 onlarda.\par
They have the tea. \'c7ay onlarda. (NOT \'e7ay\f3\u305? onlarda\f0 )\par
I have the duck. \'f6rdek bende.\par
\par
You have the coffee. kahve sende.\par
\par
Here is a post office. buras\f3\u305? bir postane\f0 .\par
Bah\'e7ede, kahvalt\f3\u305?day\u305?m.\f0  I am in the garden, at breakfast.\par
\par
\f1\lang1049 kediler kalede s\f0\lang1033\'fct i\'e7er\f1\lang1049 .\par
\par
Our house is there. Bizim evimiz orada.\par
ben mutfaktay\f3\u305?m\f1 .\par
The architect drinks tea in Ankara. mimar ankara'da \f0\lang1033\'e7ay i\'e7er\f1\lang1049 .\par
There are young horses in the castle. kalede gen\f0\lang1033\'e7 atlar var\f1\lang1049 .\par
I eat tomatoes at breakfast. Kahvalt\f3\u305?da domates yerim.\par
\par
odamda kitap okurum\f0\lang1033 . I read books in my room.\par
\par
Otel\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 nerede?\f2\lang1055  Where is the hotel? \f0\lang1033 (NOT where is hotel)\f2\lang1055\par
\f0\lang1033 Q: If I wanted to emphasize that I ask for any hotel instead of THE hotel, could I say "Bir otel nerede?" ?\par
A: No. Instead you need to emphasize that you are looking for a hotel, you can say, "Bir otel ar\f3\u305?yorum". If you use "nerede" it sounds like you are looking for a specific place.\par
\f0 A1: How would you even ask it? Would you say "Where is A hotel?" That sounds weird to me. I would say (in Turkish) something along the lines of: I'm looking for a hotel. Or is there a hotel nearby? etc.\par
{\cf0{\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK https://forum.duolingo.com/comment/7913693 }}{\fldrslt{https://forum.duolingo.com/comment/7913693\ul0\cf0}}}}\f0\fs24\par
\par
Doktor\f2\lang1055  \f0\lang1033 hastanede.\par
\f1\lang1049\par
Pasta pastanededir, hastanede de\f3\u287?il.\f2\lang1055  The cake is at the bakery, not at the hospital.\par
\par
Otelde ku\f3\'balar var.\f2  There are birds at the hotel.\par
why not "kuslar otelde"?\par
because that means "The birds are at the hotel"\par
\par
Pasta pastanededir, postanede de\f3\u287?il.\par
\f0\lang1033 Q: \f3\lang1055 But you can also say "pasta pastanede", omitting the -dir suffix? Do you include it in this case because you want to emphasize where the cake is (by contrast to it being at the post office)?\par
\f0\lang1033 A: Exactly. You better use it to emphasize where the cake is. If you were to emphasize the contrary, you'd say : Pasta postanede de\f3\u287?ildir. The cake IS NOT in the post office. \f2\lang1055\par
\par
\par
\par
\par
\f1\lang1049\par
}

### Turkey. Locative

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xNb_Os--bUs&t=662s&ab_channel=Pratikturkce

#words:
bathroom - banyo
hotel - otel
house - ev
post office - postane
sea - deniz
airport - havalimanı
pool - havuz
zoo - hayvanat bahçesi
port - liman
museum - müze
left - sol
right - sağ
kitchen - mutfak
breakfast - kahvaltı
food - yemek
castle - kale
north - kuzey - север
west - batı - запад
there - orada
Siberia - Sibirya(turk).
merkez - center
mountain - dağ

#expressions



Ben kilisedeyim, sen neredesin?
Restoranda çorba var. There is soup at the restaurant.
Otelde kuşlar var. There are birds at the hotel.
Ben okuldayım. I am at school.
Pasta pastanededir, postanede değil. The cake is at the bakery, not at the post office.
Ben hastanedeyim, sen pastanedesin. I am at the hospital you are at the patisserie.
Fil postanede domates yer. The elephant eats a tomato at the post office.
Restoranda çorba var. There is soup at the restaurant.
Banyo çok küçük. The bathroom is very small.
Sen bakkaldasın. You are at the grocery store.
Tuvalette örümcek var. There is a spider in the toilet.
Evin bir odası. A room of the house. (дома одна комната)
Affedersin, Sultan Ahmet camisi nerede? Excuse me, where is the Blue Mosque?
Havuzda çocuklar var. There are children in the pool.
Denizde kaplumbağa yok.
Hayvanat bahçesindeyiz. We are at the zoo.
Kumsalda bira iç! Drink a beer on the beach!
Kaptan limanda. The captain is at the port.

Ben havalimanında onlara kitap okurum. I read a book to them at the airport.

İstanbul'da çok müze var. There are many museums in Istambul.
Solda bir köpek var. There is a dog on the left.
Sağımda bir kuş var. There is a bird on my right.
Ayasofya'nın büyük bir bahçesi var. The Hagia Sophia has a big garden.
İstanbul Türkiye'nin kuzey batısında. Istanbul is in the northwest of Turkey.

Ayasofya'nın kuzeyinde çok müze var. There are a lot of museums in the north of the Hagia Sophia.
AyasofyaNIN kuzeyI = possessive construct. North OF THE Hagia Sophia.
Also after posesive -i if you add a case suffix like -de then you need an "n" in between. -inde -ında


Kaplumbağalar onlarda. They have the turtles.


Küçük kedi bizde. We have the little cat.
Eski şarap sende. You have the old wine.
Elmalar sende. You have the apples.
Pasta onda. She has the cake.
Onlar benim patronlarım. Those are my bosses.
Ördek bende. I have the duck.
Güzel kuşlar onda. He has the beautiful birds.
Benim kedim orada. My cat is there. My cat is over there.
Öğrenciler kalede. The students are in the castle.
Bahçede, kahvaltıdayım. I am in the garden, at breakfast.
Ben mutfaktayım. I am in the kitchen.
Burası bir postane. Here is a post office.
Ankara'da çok kedi var. There are many cats in Ankara.
Mimar Ankara'da çay içer. The architect drinks tea in Ankara.
Eski postanede köpekler var. There are dogs at the old post office.
Neden havuzda değil. Why is she not in the pool?
Ördekler denizde. The ducks are in the sea.
Limanda değilim havalimanındayım. I am not at the port, I am at the airport.
Ben havalimanında onlara kitap okurum. I read a book to them at the airport.
genç filler onda. She has the young elephants.
Burası bir postane. Here is a post office.
Orada kim var? Who is there?
Kahvaltıda kimin çocukları var? Whose children are at the breakfast?
Bizim evimiz orada. Our house is there.
Bu oda. This room.


I read a book to them at the airport. Ben havalimanında onlara kitap okurum.
i am not at the port i am at the airport. 

kumsalda kaplumbağalar var. There are turtles at the beach.
kapta limanda. The captain is at the port.
Hayvanat bahçesi. zoo.
bahçede çocuklar var. There are children in the garden. bahçe - garden
The ducks are in the sea. ördekler denizde.

neden havuzda değil. whe she is not in the pool.

I read a book to them at the airport. Ben havalimanında onlara kitap okurum.

Kitağlar sizde. You have the books.

What is the difference between "Elmaların var" and "Elmalar sende"?
The first is "You have apples." (literally, apples belonging to you exist.) The second one is saying "You have THE apples. (literally, the apples that we are discussing are with you [as opposed to in my house or in Selcan's car])
Both can be translated as "have" in English but I think you can see there's a difference in meaning.

o bizde yok. We do not have it.

He has the beautiful birds.

Here is a post office. Burası bir postane.
Orada kim var? Who is there?
I am in the kitchen. Ben mutfaktayım.
Mimar Ankara'da çay içer. 
The cats drink milk in the castle. Kediler kalede süt içer.
Whose children are at the breakfast? Kahvaltıda kimin çocuklar var?
Bizim evimiz orada.
Ankara'da güzel bir kadın.
(Ankara'da güzel bir kadın var.)
bahçede kahvaltıdayım. I am in the garden, at breakfast.
Ben hastanedeyim, sen pastanedesin.
The elephant eats a tomato at the post office. Fil postanede bir domates yer.

Yaşlı adam restoranda tavuk yer.
Why can't I start the answer with restoranda?
If you begin the translation with Restoranda then Restaurant becomes the subject of the sentence rather than the old man and the emphasis changes to the location rather than who.

Ben hastanedeyim, sen pastanedesin.
Q: I wrote the same except i omitted ben and sen. Why is it wrong as they still have the pronoun in the verb identifying the subject.
A: When you have a sentence that has more than one pronoun, you must put all the pronouns in the sentence. An example is this sentence. Hope this helps.

The old man eats chicken at the restaurant. Yaşlı adam restoranda tavuk yer.

evin bir odası. A room of the house.
Affedersin, deniz nerede?

The ducks are in the sea. Ördekler denizde.
Denizde ördekler var. There are ducks in the sea.

The museum is on the right. müze sağada.

Ayasofya'nın büyük bir bahçesi var.

There is a bird on my right. Sağımda bir kuş var.
Those are the suffixes for verb to be. You need possessives:
Benim sağımda, senin sağında, onun sağında, bizim sağımızda, sizin sağınızda, onların sağında.

çok müze, iki müze, beş müze

Ayasofya'nın kuzeyinde çok müze var.
Sibirya'nın merkezi(n!)da çok dağ çok.
Sibirya'nın merkezinde çok sayıda dağ var.
İstanbul Türkiye'nin kuzey batısında.
solda bir köpek var. bir köpek solda.

They have the small crab. Küçük yengeç onlarda.
They have the tea. Çay onlarda. (NOT çayı onlarda)
I have the duck. ördek bende.

You have the coffee. kahve sende.

Here is a post office. burası bir postane.
Bahçede, kahvaltıdayım. I am in the garden, at breakfast.

kediler kalede süt içer.

Our house is there. Bizim evimiz orada.
ben mutfaktayım.
The architect drinks tea in Ankara. mimar ankara'da çay içer.
There are young horses in the castle. kalede genç atlar var.
I eat tomatoes at breakfast. Kahvaltıda domates yerim.

odamda kitap okurum. I read books in my room.

Otel nerede? Where is the hotel? (NOT where is hotel)
Q: If I wanted to emphasize that I ask for any hotel instead of THE hotel, could I say "Bir otel nerede?" ?
A: No. Instead you need to emphasize that you are looking for a hotel, you can say, "Bir otel arıyorum". If you use "nerede" it sounds like you are looking for a specific place.
A1: How would you even ask it? Would you say "Where is A hotel?" That sounds weird to me. I would say (in Turkish) something along the lines of: I'm looking for a hotel. Or is there a hotel nearby? etc.
https://forum.duolingo.com/comment/7913693

Doktor hastanede.

Pasta pastanededir, hastanede değil. The cake is at the bakery, not at the hospital.

Otelde kuşlar var. There are birds at the hotel.
why not "kuslar otelde"?
because that means "The birds are at the hotel"

Pasta pastanededir, postanede değil.
Q: But you can also say "pasta pastanede", omitting the -dir suffix? Do you include it in this case because you want to emphasize where the cake is (by contrast to it being at the post office)?
A: Exactly. You better use it to emphasize where the cake is. If you were to emphasize the contrary, you'd say : Pasta postanede değildir. The cake IS NOT in the post office.
